verses.verse: Come <S%G33><s%> now, <S%G3568><s%> you rich, <S%G4145><s%> weep <S%G2799><s%> and howl <S%G3649><s%> for your miseries <S%G5004><s%> which are coming <S%G1904><s%> upon you.
Your riches <S%G4149><s%> have rotted <S%G4595><s%> and your garments <S%G2440><s%> have become <S%G1096><s%> moth-eaten.

Your gold <S%G5557><s%> and your silver <S%G696><s%> have rusted; <S%G2728><s%> and their rust <S%G2447><s%> will be a witness <S%G3142><s%> against you and will consume <S%G2068><s%> your flesh <S%G4561><s%> like <S%G5613><s%> fire. <S%G4442><s%> It is in the last <S%G2078><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> that you have stored <S%G2343><s%> up your treasure! <S%G2343><s%>

Behold, <S%G2400><s%> the pay <S%G3408><s%> of the laborers <S%G2040><s%> who mowed <S%G270><s%> your fields, <S%G5561><s%> [and] which has been withheld <S%G7504><s%> by you, cries <S%G2896><s%> out [against you]; and the outcry <S%G995><s%> of those <S%G3588><s%> who did <S%G2325><s%> the harvesting <S%G2325><s%> has reached <S%G1525><s%> the ears <S%G3775><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> of Sabaoth. <S%G4519><s%>

You have lived <S%G5171><s%> luxuriously <S%G5171><s%> on the earth <S%G1093><s%> and led <S%G4684><s%> a life <S%G4684><s%> of wanton <S%G4684><s%> pleasure; <S%G4684><s%> you have fattened <S%G5142><s%> your hearts <S%G2588><s%> in a day <S%G2250><s%> of slaughter. <S%G4967><s%>
You have condemned <S%G2613><s%> and put <S%G5407><s%> to death <S%G5407><s%> the righteous <S%G1342><s%> [man;] he does not resist <S%G498><s%> you.

Be patient, <S%G3114><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> brethren, <S%G80><s%> until <S%G2193><s%> the coming <S%G3952><s%> of the Lord. <S%G2962><s%> Behold, <S%G2400><s%> the farmer <S%G1092><s%> waits <S%G1551><s%> for the precious <S%G5093><s%> produce <S%G2590><s%> of the soil, <S%G1093><s%> being patient <S%G3114><s%> about <S%G1909><s%> it, until <S%G2193><s%> it gets <S%G2983><s%> the early <S%G4291><s%> and late <S%G3797><s%> rains.
You too <S%G2532><s%> be patient; <S%G3114><s%> strengthen <S%G4741><s%> your hearts, <S%G2588><s%> for the coming <S%G3952><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%> is at hand. <S%G1448><s%>

Do not complain, <S%G4727><s%> brethren, <S%G80><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> one <S%G240><s%> another, <S%G240><s%> that you yourselves may not be judged; <S%G2919><s%> behold, <S%G2400><s%> the Judge <S%G2923><s%> is standing <S%G2476><s%> right <S%G4253><s%> at the door. <S%G2374><s%>

As an example, <S%G5262><s%> brethren, <S%G80><s%> of suffering <S%G2552><s%> and patience, <S%G3115><s%> take <S%G2983><s%> the prophets <S%G4396><s%> who <S%G3739><s%> spoke <S%G2980><s%> in the name <S%G3686><s%> of the Lord. <S%G2962><s%>

Behold, <S%G2400><s%> we count <S%G3106><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> blessed <S%G3106><s%> who endured. <S%G5278><s%> You have heard <S%G191><s%> of the endurance <S%G5281><s%> of Job <S%G2492><s%> and have seen <S%G3708><s%> the outcome <S%G5056><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%>'s dealings, that the Lord is full <S%G4184><s%> of compassion <S%G4184><s%> and [is] merciful. <S%G3629><s%>

But above <S%G4253><s%> all, <S%G3956><s%> my brethren, <S%G80><s%> do not swear, <S%G3660><s%> either <S%G3383><s%> by heaven <S%G3772><s%> or <S%G3383><s%> by earth <S%G1093><s%> or <S%G3383><s%> with any <S%G5100><s%> other <S%G243><s%> oath; <S%G3727><s%> but let your yes <S%G3483><s%> be yes, <S%G3483><s%> and your no, <S%G3756><s%> no; <S%G3756><s%> so <S%G2443><s%> that you may not fall <S%G4098><s%> under <S%G5259><s%> judgment. <S%G2920><s%>
Is anyone <S%G5100><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> you suffering <S%G2553><s%>? Let him pray. <S%G4336><s%> Is anyone <S%G5100><s%> cheerful <S%G2114><s%>? Let him sing <S%G5567><s%> praises. <S%G5567><s%>

Is anyone <S%G5100><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> you sick <S%G770><s%>? Let him call <S%G4341><s%> for the elders <S%G4245><s%> of the church, <S%G1577><s%> and let them pray <S%G4336><s%> over <S%G1909><s%> him, anointing <S%G218><s%> him with oil <S%G1637><s%> in the name <S%G3686><s%> of the Lord; <S%G2962><s%>

and the prayer <S%G2171><s%> offered in faith <S%G4102><s%> will restore <S%G4982><s%> the one who is sick, <S%G2577><s%> and the Lord <S%G2962><s%> will raise <S%G1453><s%> him up, and if <S%G2579><s%> he has committed <S%G4160><s%> sins, <S%G266><s%> they will be forgiven <S%G863><s%> him.

Therefore, <S%G3767><s%> confess <S%G1843><s%> your sins <S%G266><s%> to one <S%G240><s%> another, <S%G240><s%> and pray <S%G4336><s%> for one <S%G240><s%> another, <S%G240><s%> so <S%G3704><s%> that you may be healed. <S%G2390><s%> The effective <S%G1754><s%> prayer <S%G1162><s%> of a righteous <S%G1342><s%> man <S%G1342><s%> can <S%G2480><s%> accomplish <S%G1754><s%> much. <S%G4183><s%>

Elijah <S%G2243><s%> was a man <S%G444><s%> with a nature <S%G3663><s%> like <S%G3663><s%> ours, <S%G1473><s%> and he prayed <S%G4336><s%> earnestly <S%G4335><s%> that it might not rain; <S%G1026><s%> and it did not rain <S%G1026><s%> on the earth <S%G1093><s%> for three <S%G5140><s%> years <S%G1763><s%> and six <S%G1803><s%> months. <S%G3376><s%>
And he prayed <S%G4336><s%> again, <S%G3825><s%> and the sky <S%G3772><s%> poured <S%G1325><s%> rain, <S%G5205><s%> and the earth <S%G1093><s%> produced <S%G985><s%> its fruit. <S%G2590><s%>
My brethren, <S%G80><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> you strays <S%G4105><s%> from the truth, <S%G225><s%> and one <S%G5100><s%> turns <S%G1994><s%> him back, <S%G1994><s%>

let him know <S%G1097><s%> that he who turns <S%G1994><s%> a sinner <S%G268><s%> from the error <S%G4106><s%> of his way <S%G3598><s%> will save <S%G4982><s%> his soul <S%G5590><s%> from death, <S%G2288><s%> and will cover <S%G2572><s%> a multitude <S%G4128><s%> of sins. <S%G266><s%>
